capstone.game

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.game.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    The Level class is the main coordinating-unit of all game-logic. It manages player movements, rendering elements and all game-events.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Level.Difficulty
      A measure of the difficulty of the level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(LevelBuilder builder)
        Constructs a Level. The power of refactoring (LevelBuilder) made this class 1000 lines smaller.
        Parameters:
        builder - The LevelBuilder containing all the data for this class.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Direction> directions)
        The most important method in the class, which is called on every frame to do everything there is to do. It first checks if the screen size has changed to determine if the screen has to be redrawn and the PageGrid updated. It then updates the page which moves the dynamic obstacles further if the frameCount equals the difficulty (see description of Difficulty enum). Then, it moves the players and evaluates their new positions to check for collisions and determine what those collisions mean.
        Parameters:
        directions - The map from IDs to Directions, as passed by the Game class.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Returns:
        The name of the level.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Returns:
        True if the game has been won or lost.

      • hasWon

        public boolean hasWon()
        Returns:
        True if the player(s) collected all keys and exited one of the doors.

      • hasLost

        public boolean hasLost()
        Returns:
        True if all players are dead.

      • redraw

        public void redraw()
        Does all the things necessary to redraw the current page onto the screen. This method is very expensive and should only be called when you have to do a complete re-rendering of EVERYTHING in the level, e.g. after showing the menu (which is a completely different screen).

      • theme

        public Theme theme()
        Returns:
        The theme of the level.

        public void theme(Theme theme)
        Sets the theme of the level.
        Parameters:
        theme - The new theme.

      • players

        public java.util.List<Player> players()
        Returns:
        A list of active and dead players.

      • hidden

        public java.util.List<Profile> hidden()
        Returns:
        A list of the players still hidden in the level.

      • pageSize

        public com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.TerminalSize pageSize()
        Returns the size of a page on the screen, i.e. the terminalSize without the rows for the status-bar.
        Returns:
        The size of a page on the screen.

      • keysCollected

        public int keysCollected()
        Returns:
        The number of keys collected by the player(s) so far.

      • totalKeys

        public int totalKeys()
        Returns:
        The total number of keys in the level (collected and not).

        Returns:
        The grid used in the level.

        public Page currentPage()
        Returns:
        The current page shown on the screen. Same as grid().currentPage().

      • _updatePage

        private void _updatePage()
        Handles calling _page.update() when the _frameCount is equal to the delay associated with the difficulty.
        See Also:
        Level.Difficulty

      • _movePlayers

        private void _movePlayers(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Direction> directions)
        Moves each player that performed a move in the current frame.
        Parameters:
        directions - The map from ids to directions.

      • _move

        private void _move(Player player,
                   Direction direction)
        Moves a player into the specified direction if the player does not go negative. If the player stood on an element, e.g. an entrance, that element is re-rendered. If that element the player stood on was an entrance and there are still hidden players, one of them can be unhidden.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to move.
        direction - The direction to move the player in.

      • _unhidePlayer

        private void _unhidePlayer(Point point)
        Promotes a profile from the _hidden profiles into an actual player, by creating a new player at the given point (should be an entrance) with the first profile retrieved from the _hidden collection. That profile is random.
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which to unhide one of the profiles.

      • _evaluatePlayers

        private void _evaluatePlayers(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Direction> directions)
        Evaluates the positions of all players. This means checking if they need to go back in case of a collision or checking if they're dead.
        Parameters:
        directions - The map from ids to moved directions.

      • _evaluate

        private void _evaluate(Player player)
        Evaluates a player's position with respect to the other game elements in the level. It is looked if the player's point collides with any other element in the screen and if so, a certain action is performed. What that action is depends on the element, e.g. just going backwards when bumping into walls, or revealing a mystery-event when opening a mystery-box, for example. When, after evaluation, a player is seen to have moved onto another page, the grid's current page is updated.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to evaluate.

      • _checkPlayerCollision

        private void _checkPlayerCollision(Player player,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Direction> directions)
        This one was tasty. Checks if players have collided or moved past each other, i.e. moved over each other. Prevents such an action if necessary.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check collision for.
        directions - The map from ids to directions of the last frame.

      • _handleMysteryBox

        private void _handleMysteryBox(MysteryBox mysteryBox,
                               Player player)
        Handles all the events of the MysteryBox. Can't refactor that into the MysteryBox class, as it performs too many internal modifications on the level that shouldn't be accessible from the outside to another class. Maybe in C++ we would declare the MysteryBox a friend class.
        Parameters:
        mysteryBox - The mystery-box instance to reveal.
        player - The player who interacted with the mystery-box.

      • _generate

        private boolean _generate(Element.Kind kind)
        Handles generation of a new element due to a MysteryBox. Takes care of the case when the generated element is on the position of the player, in which case the player is asked to go back. Also handles the situation when the level is too full to generate a new element.
        Parameters:
        kind - The kind of element to generate.
        Returns:
        true if the element could be generated, false if the level was too full.

      • _remove

        private boolean _remove(Element.Kind kind)
        Attempts to remove an element of a certain kind from the grid.
        Parameters:
        kind - The kind of element to attempt to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the removal was possible, else false.

      • _kill

        private void _kill(Player player)
        Performs all the necessary operations to kill a player, e.g. moving the player from the list of alive players to that of dead players.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to kill.

      • _checkResize

        private void _checkResize()
        Checks if the screen and grid needs to be resized.

      • _clear

        private void _clear(com.googlecode.lanterna.screen.Screen screen)
        Fixes the bug in lanterna that causes unoccupied space on the screen to be displayed with green Xs instead of just the default background.
        Parameters:
        screen - The screen to clear.
